class_notes:
This course will be offered fully ONLINE.
This course is a follow-up to QTM 100: Introduction to Statistical Inference. Students will apply many of the concepts and skills learned in QTM 100 to a broader field of statistical analysis: multivariable analysis and model building. Assignments are based on real-world data and problems in political science. Both labs and assignments allow students to apply concepts from class toward programming skills in R and Github, which are becoming standard practice in academics and industry. General topics covered include: - examining data and transforming data - one-way and two-way ANOVAs - linear regression - dummy variable regression - non-numeric outcomes (poisson, logistic regression) - diagnostics of unusual and influential data - non-linearity (splines) - non-constant variance, non-normality and collinearity - model selection.
course_description: Students will apply concepts and skills learned in QTM 100 to a broader field of statistical analysis: multivariable analysis and model building. Implementation of appropriate statistical methods, hands-on data analysis with statistical software, interpretation of analysis results.
